cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles E of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting west-northwest into southeastern North Carolina, then stalling and turning northward across the western Carolinas and central Appalachians before curving toward the Mid-Atlantic/Northeast early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC; Storm Surge Watch: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds; Tropical Storm Warning: North of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA and Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort; Storm Surge Warning: South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impacts along the North Carolina and northeastern South Carolina coasts with eventual inland impacts across the Carolinas, Appalachians, Mid-Atlantic and parts of the Northeast
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤4%) chance of tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds; breezy conditions more likely than damaging winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Delaware River/upper Delaware Bay near South Jersey Port
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate rain possible early next week as the remnant low tracks north of the port, but widespread totals should remain below 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey shore through the weekend due to large swells from Florence
